str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From dikaios; to render just or innocent.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High, lofty. From hupsos; lofty.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
An abominable thing, an accursed thing. From bdelusso; a detestation, i.e. idolatry.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
